abstract.text: For therapeutic monoclonal antibodies (mAbs), detailed analysis of the structural integrity and heterogeneity, which results from multiple types of post-translational modifications (PTMs), is relevant to various processes, including product characterization, storage stability and quality control.
Despite the recent rapid development of new bioanalytical techniques, it is still challenging to completely characterize the proteoform profile of a mAb.
As a nearly indispensable tool in mAb analysis, mass spectrometry (MS) provides unique structural information at multiple levels.

Here, we tested a hybrid strategy for the comprehensive characterization of micro-heterogeneity by integrating 2 state-of-the-art MS-based approaches, high-resolution native MS and targeted glycan profiling, to perform complementary analysis at the intact protein level and released glycan level, respectively.
We compared the performance of these methods using samples of engineered half-body IgG4s and a panel of mAbs approved for human use.

The glycosylation characterization data derived from these approaches were found to be mutually consistent in composition profiling, and complementary in identification and relative-quantitation of low-abundant uncommon glycoforms.

In addition, multiple other sources of micro-heterogeneity, such as glycation, lack of glycosylation, and loss of light chains, could be detected by this approach, and the contribution of multiple types of modifications to the overall micro-heterogeneity could be assessed using our superposition algorithm.
Our data demonstrate that the hybrid strategy allows reliable and thorough characterization of mAbs, revealing product characteristics that would easily be missed if only a single approach were used.

body_text.text: To compare the simulated result with the native MS spectra, the native MS spectra (acquired in profile mode) are pre-processed by convoluting the ESI spectrum to a zero-charge state spectrum using the Protein Deconvolution package (Thermo Fisher Scientific).
Subsequently, the standard Pearson correlation is performed to evaluate the data generated from the 2 platforms.

Therapeutic monoclonal antibodies (mAbs) are inherently heterogeneous in structure due to numerous factors, including posttranslational modifications (PTMs), incomplete processing, susceptibility to degradation, and disulfide shuffling.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: [1][2][3][4] In particular, the glycosylation at Asn297 in the Fc-region contributes greatly to the micro-heterogeneity, affecting the conformation, half-life in serum, efficacy and safety of mAbs.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: [5][6][7] The glycan chains stabilize the CH2 domain, and removal of certain carbohydrate residues often leads to conformational changes, a decrease in thermal stability, and loss of effector functions.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: 8 For instance, removal of terminal galactose reduces complement-dependent cytotoxicity (CDC), 9,10 while a decreased level of core fucosylation enhances antibody-dependent cell-mediated cytotoxicity (ADCC).
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: [11][12][13] Other modifications made to the protein backbone, such as C-terminal lysine clipping, 14 deamidation, and oxidation also contribute to the heterogeneity of mAb products.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: 15,16 In some cases, more substantial changes in the protein scaffold can be introduced by either incomplete processing or degradation, 17 influencing the antigen binding capability 18 or the in vivo clearance rate of mAbs.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: 19 These biologic consequences make comprehensive characterizations of heterogeneity critical for the design, production and clinical use of mAbs.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Currently, mass spectrometry (MS)-based techniques are widely used for the analysis of mAb heterogeneity with special emphasis on glycosylation.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: It is technically possible to characterize mAb glycosylation at several levels: the intact protein level, the glycopeptide level and the released glycan level.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: [20][21][22][23][24] MS analysis of released glycans is still the method of choice for obtaining structural information on the glycome.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Glycan analysis allows for rapid, high-throughput characterization of mAb samples by matching the light chain retention time and accurate mass, providing in-depth structural information on the glycans, including even linkage details.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: 25 Glycopeptide analysis provides simultaneous identification of the glycoproteins and their glycans, and localization, occupancy and micro-heterogeneity can be evaluated by using tandem mass spectrometry (MS/MS) techniques.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: 20,24,26 Recently, site-specific glycosylation analysis of mAbs was shown to benefit from the sensitivity and specify achievable by targeted approaches using multiple reaction monitoring (MRM).
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: 27 At the other end of the spectrum, by directly analyzing the intact protein, it is possible to simultaneously and quantitatively profile the distribution of the main glycoproteoforms, which is an important indication for product integrity and consistency.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: [28][29][30] Although these approaches have proven powerful in providing structural information, no single approach is sufficient for an in-depth characterization of all aspects of heterogeneity.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: In a recent comprehensive analysis of cetuximab, Ayoub et al. combined multiple schemes (intact analysis, middle-down, middle-up and bottom-up) to reveal distinct glycosylation profiles on the Fab and Fc region, as well as a sequence error in the reported sequence of the light chain.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: 31 This study provided a good example of the benefit of integrating information at multiple levels in dissection of a mAb product.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Here, we combined 2 cutting-edge MS-based approaches, i.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: e.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: , high-resolution native MS for the global profiling of co-existing proteoforms and targeted glycan analysis of released N-glycans for the structural analysis of individual glycoforms, to characterize 12 therapeutic mAbs, 7 of which are marketed.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Combining the data obtained at the intact protein level and released glycan level, we were able to better resolve the overall heterogeneity exhibited by a mAb and quantitatively profile them with satisfactory confidence.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: In addition, other sources of micro-heterogeneity, such as incomplete lysine clipping, lack of glycosylation, loss of could be inferred simultaneously from the native MS data.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: The complementary structural information provided by the 2 approaches allow the micro-heterogeneity and structural integrity of mAbs to be characterized in unprecedented detail, useful for pharmaceutical development and mAb quality control, especially when these differentiated proteoforms exhibit difference in potency.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: In addition, our strategy can be used to detect structural alterations induced by storageinduced degradation of biopharmaceuticals.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Results
Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

To evaluate the performance of native MS and targeted glycan profiling in the analysis of N-glycosylation at the intact protein level and released glycan level, we compared the data provided by these 2 approaches.
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: Three IgG4-Dhinge mutants, i.e., F405T/ Y407E, Y407Q and Y407K, were selected as model analytes because their defined half-molecule state harbors only one N-glycosylation site and thus allows unpaired glycan chains to be characterized at the intact protein level.
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: Moreover, as suggested by previous studies, 32 each of these 3 mutants exhibits high levels of galactose, sialic acids and branching, providing a wide range of glycoforms valuable for our method validation.
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: In the native MS measurements, signals corresponding to various glycoproteoforms could be baseline-resolved based on their unique molecular weight (MW) accurately measured using the Orbitrap EMR mass analyzer (Fig. 1A).
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: Then, the composition of the corresponding species, i.e., the stoichiometry of carbohydrate residues, was calculated using the MW of individual residues.
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: In targeted glycan profiling (Fig. 1B), the glycans released from the glycoproteins were identified by mapping their chromatographic elution profiles to those of the common glycosylations on commercial mAb products covered by a library.
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: 25 The glycan compositions were then further verified by the MW measured using the MS coupled with LC.
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: Both approaches yielded results in aspects of accurate MW, glycan composition and relative abundance.
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: To quantitatively compare the 2 data sets, for each mutant we plotted the relative abundances of detected glycans against their MW in a mirror-like fashion (Fig. 1C).
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: Illustratively for IgG4-Dhinge-Y407Q, with 25 and 24 glycoforms mass-assigned by native MS and targeted glycan profiling, respectively, 14 species could be assigned by both approaches, accounting for 92% of the total glycan abundance ( Fig. 1C; Table S2).
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: The Pearson correlation coefficient (R) of the full-range mirror-plots is 0.84.
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: In addition to the common glycoforms, the more sophisticated di-and trisialylated species such as 6,5,1,2 (annotated as numbers of Hex, HexNAc,Fuc,Sia incorporated, sic passim) and 6,5,1,3 were also detected in similar abundances by both approaches.
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: Similar observations were made in analysis of Y407K and F405T/ Y407E (see also Fig. 1).
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: These distribution maps and the R values calculated for the comparisons suggest an overall good agreement between the 2 approaches in terms of detection and identification of the predominant glycoforms, as well as many low abundant ones.
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: Between the 2 data sets, the discrepancies in abundances of certain glycoforms may partially be attributed to artifacts induced by either approach.
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: Particularly, native MS reported higher abundances of most of the glycoforms containing 5 Hex-NAc residues compared with glycan profiling (Table S2), suggesting the potential presence of a systematic bias.
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: In native MS, all glycoforms are separated and assigned solely based on MW, and thus the accuracy of quantitation for certain species may be compromised by the occasional overlapping of signals of different glycoforms whose MW difference is smaller than the peak widths, in spite of the instruments' resolving power.
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: Roughly, in our native MS analysis a minimum MW difference of 20 Da is necessary for unambiguous assignments of different glycoforms.
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: For instance, since the MW of glycoform G1 (4,4,0,0) is only 16 Da heavier than that of G0F (3,4,1,0), in the native MS data the signal peak of G1 are merged into that of G0F, resulting in an overestimated abundance of G0F, and false negative detection of G1 ( Fig. 1; Table S2).
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: In sharp contrast, targeted profiling provides the released glycans with more efficient separation (based on the chromatographic elution time and MW) and composition verification based on tandem MS patterns when necessary, allowing signals to be assigned with higher confidence.
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: However, biases in the released glycan analysis may exist, for instance due to difference in ionization and detection response that may affect quantitation.
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: 36 Moreover, MS analysis of released glycans can result in undesired fragmentation, 37 leading to diminished quantitative detection of the species of origin and false positive detection of fragments, especially if these fragment species are not covered by the reference library.
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: As exemplified by the elution profiles of glycans released from F405T/Y407E ( Fig. 1B), while 2 of the 5,4,1,2 species were eluted at 25.08 and 25.91 min, respectively, 2 minor species mass-assigned as 5,4,1,1 were observed at the same elution positions, implying that these 5,4,1,1 species were yielded by loss of a sialic acid residue from a subpopulation of 5,4,1,2 at the MS detection stage.
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: The efficient separation provided by the glycan profiling also allows the exact linkages of carbohydrate residues to be assigned, benefiting from the distinguishable LC-retention and gas-phase fragmentation behaviors exhibited by the structural isomers.
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: As exemplified by the glycan G2FS (5,4,1,1), 3 structural isomers could be identified by matching with the accurate masses and the calibrated chromatographic retention times from the library (Table S3).
body_text.section: Comparative analysis of IgG4-Dhinge half-body Nglycosylation at the intact protein and released glycan levels

body_text.text: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity
Next, using a similar workflow, we characterized 7 mAbs approved for human use with high resolution native MS to complement previously performed analyses of their released glycans.
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: 25 Use of intact protein samples instead of the released glycans increases not only the total MW of the analytes, but also increases the overall heterogeneity of the sample molecules due to the presence of other modifications, as exemplified in Fig. 2.
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: To best extract the non-N-glycosylation-induced heterogeneity, we additionally measured the N-deglycosylated format of these intact mAbs.
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: As illustrated by 3 examples, mAb backbones can undergo different types of modification that can occur to various extents (Fig. 2).
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: Upon removal of the N-glycan, trastuzumab exhibits a quite uniform MW, suggesting minimal other modifications, and complete C-terminal Lys processing ( Fig. 2A).
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: In sharp contrast, both infliximab and bevacizumab exhibit a broad range of intact masses, resulting largely from incomplete C-terminal Lys processing and multiple glycation events, respectively (Fig. 2B, C).
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: Taking advantage of its relatively monodisperse protein backbone, the glycosylation profiling for trastuzumab appears to be nearly as straightforward as for the IgG4-Dhinge mutants.
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: However, as the carbohydrate content of the intact IgG1 molecule originates from 2 glycan chains, the analysis at the glycan level is needed to determine the detailed glycan composition.
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: Based on the MW and relative abundances of individual N-glycan chains determined at the released glycan level, we simulated the distribution of MW of the intact mAb assuming random pairing of the 2 glycan chains, and compared it with the experimentally measured native MS spectrum.
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: In this spectrum 14 unique MWs corresponding to different glycan compositions could be assigned ( Fig. 2A, Fig. S1), including both abundant glycans, such as 6,8,2,0 (G0F/G0F), 7,8,2,0 (G0F/ G1F), 8,8,2,0 (G0F/G2F or G1F/G1F), and lower abundant glycans, such as 6,6,0,0 to 10,8,2,2.
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: As illustrated in Fig. 3A, a high correlation coefficient (R D 0.92) was obtained between the 2 sets of data, demonstrating the validity of direct profiling of the paired glycan composition on IgGs by native MS. However, since in the native MS data a single composition may originate from multiple possible combinations of glycan pairs, analysis at the intact protein level alone is insufficient to determine the contribution of each pair.
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: Also, it is noteworthy that the assumption of random glycan pairing we made for the simulation may not represent the actual situation, 38 which could contribute to the remaining differences in abundance between the measured and simulated data sets.
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: Clipping of the C-terminal Lys occurs to a variable extent in most mAb products.
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: Although manufacturers usually consider these variants to have no considerable effect on the potency or safety profile, a recent study demonstrated that C-terminal Lys may interfere with the ordered oligomerization of IgG at the cell surface, leading to suboptimal C1q binding and CDC of opsonized cells.
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: 14 Providing an alternative to charge-based separation techniques such as isoelectric focusing (IEF) electrophoresis (either capillary-or slab-based) and ion exchange chromatography, 39,40 MS analysis of deglycosylated mAb allows simple evaluation of the amount of C-terminal Lys retained (0, 1 or 2, annotated as K0, K1 and K2, respectively).
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: Unlike trastuzumab whose C-terminal Lysine residues were completely processed (i.e., only K0), infliximab displayed K0, K1 and K2 variants in comparable abundances (Fig. 2B, lower  panel), resulting in a relatively complicated mass spectrum even in its deglycosylated form (Fig. 2B, upper panel).
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: Based on the MW and distribution of the K0, K1 and K2 backbones, we were able to determine the compositions and abundances of the N-glycan chain pairs attached to infliximab, by subtracting the contributions of K0, K1 and K2 backbones according to their ratios (Fig. 2B, upper panel).
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: The extracted quantitative profile of infliximab is consistent with a previous study using capillary electrophoresis (CE), 41 demonstrating the comparable effectiveness of native MS in separating charge variants of mAbs.
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: Glycation caused by exposure of mAb to reducing sugars is another common type of modification that occurs either under physiologic conditions or during cell culture.
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: 42,43 In many cases, glycation alters the charge profile of pharmaceutical products and may thus affect its quality.
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: 44,45 Because the net contribution of a monosaccharide to the total MW of protein is equivalent regardless of its site of attachment through a glycan chain or to the backbone, in the intact-MW analysis the removal of N-glycosylation is required to distinguish the glycation from the extended N-glycosylation.
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: Indeed, although the glycosylated format of bevacizumab showed a profile similar in heterogeneity to trastuzumab, removal of the N-glycans demonstrated a significantly higher extent of glycation for bevacizumab (»1.3 copies of hexose residues on average) (Fig. 2C, lower panel).
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: As a non-enzymatic process, glycation introduces a reducing sugar at a primary amine on the protein, either the lysine (Lys) side-chain epsilon amino group or the a-amino N-terminus.
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: 46,47 While the precise localization of glycation sites  requires the analysis at the peptide level using a bottom-up approach, [48][49][50][51] the distribution of glycated mAbs and the average glycation level are unique information provided by analysis at the intact protein level.
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: Based on the distribution of glycan chains profiled at the glycan level, the MW of protein backbone and the glycation profile measured at the intact protein level, we simulated a profile reflecting the overall heterogeneity including contributions from both glycosylation and glycation, and compared the simulated profile with the experimental profile (Fig. 3B).
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: The consistent patterns of the profile envelopes (R D 0.95) demonstrates the accuracy of profiling results of individual types of modifications, and the validity of reconstitution of overall heterogeneity using these data.
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: We made another simulation, now excluding glycation, as shown in Fig. 3B.
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: The resulting simulated spectrum exhibited a distinct peak distribution compared with the experimental MS data and the correlation decreased from 0.95 to 0.69, demonstrating the effect of glycation on the overall heterogeneity of this mAb molecule.
body_text.section: Resolving other types of modification enhancing mAb micro-heterogeneity

body_text.text: Monitoring the global structural integrity of mAbs

Because some of the studied mAbs had been stored for extended periods and their expiration date had passed, we examined the global stability and structural integrity of the samples, using native MS as primary read-out.
body_text.section: Monitoring the global structural integrity of mAbs

body_text.text: Next to the full mAb structures (denoted L(2)H(2)g(2) where L, H and g denote the light, heavy, and glycan chains, respectively) we also detected mAb-like products lacking the light chains or one or 2 glycan chains.
body_text.section: Monitoring the global structural integrity of mAbs

body_text.text: Even for the structurally most stable trastuzumab, which exhibited the least structural heterogeneity of the mAbs studied here, we detected a low abundant species lacking one full N-glycan chain (L(2)H(2)g(1); Fig. 4A).
body_text.section: Monitoring the global structural integrity of mAbs

body_text.text: The profile of the retained N-glycan chain resembles the distribution of the ensemble of glycan chains profiled for the overall population of trastuzumab (Fig. S2).
body_text.section: Monitoring the global structural integrity of mAbs

body_text.text: Such single site-glycosylation was detected for all investigated mAbs, with the relative abundance ranging from 0.8% to 2.8% (Table 1).
body_text.section: Monitoring the global structural integrity of mAbs

body_text.text: Singly glycosylated IgGs have been shown to display a decrease in thermal stability, C1q binding affinity, Fc gamma receptors (FcgRs) binding affinity and ADCC.
body_text.section: Monitoring the global structural integrity of mAbs

body_text.text: 52 Among the mAb samples stored for long periods, bevacizumab and ofatumumab exhibited additional partial loss of their light chains.
body_text.section: Monitoring the global structural integrity of mAbs

body_text.text: For bevacizumab, we detected species missing both light chains, with 2, 1 or 0 N-glycan chains attached.
body_text.section: Monitoring the global structural integrity of mAbs

body_text.text: Notably, in both cases, no mAb molecules lacking only one light chain were observed, suggesting the removal of the light chains is not a random or sequential process (Fig. 4B).
body_text.section: Monitoring the global structural integrity of mAbs

body_text.text: Species of low abundance lacking both light chains were also detected in ofatumumab, yet no further glycan loss was observed (Fig. S3).
body_text.section: Monitoring the global structural integrity of mAbs

body_text.text: In healthy mammals, failure of light chain association usually results in rapid intracellular degradation of the heavy chains due to the inefficient transport from ER to Golgi, 53,54 preventing the expression of heavy chain antibodies (L(0)H (2)).
body_text.section: Monitoring the global structural integrity of mAbs

body_text.text: The production of natural L(0)H(2) with VH/CH1 domains partially removed was found in humans with H chain disease.
body_text.section: Monitoring the global structural integrity of mAbs

body_text.text: 55 All the L(0)H(2) species observed in this work retained heavy chain integrity, implying that the absence of light chains is likely the result of degradation.
body_text.section: Monitoring the global structural integrity of mAbs

body_text.text: The exact nature of the reactions responsible for such release of the light chain remains to be investigated.
body_text.section: Monitoring the global structural integrity of mAbs

body_text.text: We rule out in-source dissociation of the products during the MS measurement, since no free light chain ions were detected under the gentle ionization conditions of data acquisition.
body_text.section: Monitoring the global structural integrity of mAbs

body_text.text: In addition, the charge density carried by the L(0)H(2) species is in line with the empirical expectation, 56 suggesting these species are not the products of gas phase fragmentation.
body_text.section: Monitoring the global structural integrity of mAbs

body_text.text: 57 Native MS provides a convenient means to characterize the heterogeneity-inducing degradation products of proteins in solution without any front-end separation.
body_text.section: Monitoring the global structural integrity of mAbs

body_text.text: Discussion

Here, we demonstrated that glycoprotein analysis at the intact protein and released glycan level using high-resolution native MS and targeted glycan profiling, respectively, can provide mutually consistent information on the composition and abundance of glycoprotein proteoforms.
body_text.section: Discussion

body_text.text: However, careful Figure 4.
body_text.section: Discussion

body_text.text: mAb structural integrity probed by native MS at the intact protein level.
body_text.section: Discussion

body_text.text: (A) Native mass spectrum of trastuzumab, which populates predominantly the intact format L(2)H(2)g(2) (blue; L, H and g denote light chain, heavy chain and Nglycan chain, respectively, with numbers indicated in the parentheses) and marginally the single site-glycosylated format L(2)H(2)g(1) (orange).
body_text.section: Discussion

body_text.text: (B) For bevacizumab, in addition to the 2 formats detected in (A), the light-chain-free species with 2, 1 and 0 N-glycan chains attached (green, red and purple, respectively) are detected.
body_text.section: Discussion

body_text.text: Relative abundances of each species are estimated using summed ion intensities corresponding to all detected charge states, with data normalized to the ensemble of species and plotted on a logarithmic scale in the insets.
body_text.section: Discussion

body_text.text: Reported as the average copies of monosaccharide residues attached to the mAb.
body_text.section: Discussion

body_text.text: A minimum abundance of 5% of the singly glycated species (relative to the nonglycated species) was set as the threshold for calculation.
body_text.section: Discussion

body_text.text: optimization and proper data processing are needed to minimize the artifacts induced in either approach.
body_text.section: Discussion

body_text.text: Both methods provide highly complementary data, but also have their own niche.
body_text.section: Discussion

body_text.text: The multiple-dimensional separation of glycoforms and the tandem MS data gathered by targeted profiling of released glycans enables the differentiation of structural isomers, as well as elucidation of the linkages within carbohydrate residues.
body_text.section: Discussion

body_text.text: Native MS analysis at the intact protein level provides a global snapshot of the glycoform distribution with high confidence, and can concomitantly reveal co-occurring modification on the protein, such as truncations and glycations.
body_text.section: Discussion

body_text.text: In the combined analysis of a sample panel of model proteins that included aged therapeutic mAbs, we demonstrated the power of using these hybrid MS-based approaches concomitantly.
body_text.section: Discussion

body_text.text: The combined analysis provided detailed structural information, both qualitative and quantitative, and better resolved the overall heterogeneity caused not only by N-glycosylation, but also by C-terminal Lys processing, glycation, single site-glycosylation, and loss of specific polypeptide chains.
body_text.section: Discussion

body_text.text: A comparison of simulated and experimental data, using dedicated mathematical algorithms, allowed the heterogeneity to be further assessed and cross-validated.
body_text.section: Discussion

body_text.text: Both approaches provide reasonable high-throughput because they are compatible with automated sampling, and neither of them requires any timeconsuming stages.
body_text.section: Discussion

body_text.text: Therefore, we conclude that the combination of these 2 workflows will provide an ideal platform to measure micro-heterogeneity, not only in IgGs, but also in all other kind of industrial and plasma glycoproteins.
body_text.section: Discussion

body_text.text: Materials & methods
Materials
The monoclonal hinge-deleted IgG4 antibody (IgG4-Dhinge-WT) and its mutants (Y407A, Y407E, Y407Q and Y407K) used in this study were gifts from Genmab (Utrecht, The Netherlands).
body_text.section: Materials

body_text.text: These proteins were expressed in HEK-293F cells and purified as described previously.
body_text.section: Materials

body_text.text: 32 The 7 therapeutic mAbs used in this work (with specifications are listed in Table S1) were kind gifts from the UC Davis Medical Center, all representing expired batches (lot number unknown).
body_text.section: Materials

body_text.text: PNGase F was obtained from Roche (Indianapolis, USA).
body_text.section: Materials

body_text.text: Dithiothreitol (DTT) was purchased from Sigma-Aldrich (Steinheim, Germany).
body_text.section: Materials

body_text.text: High-resolution native MS analysis using an Orbitrap EMR

Prior to native MS measurement, the aqueous environment of all mAb stock solutions (IgG4-Dhinge antibodies were prepared in PBS; the powder of therapeutic mAbs was reconstituted in Milli-Q water) were substituted with 150 mM aqueous ammonium acetate (pH adjusted to 7.5 using ammonium hydroxide) by ultrafiltration using a 10 kDa cut-off filter (Merck Millipore, Germany).
body_text.section: High-resolution native MS analysis using an Orbitrap EMR

body_text.text: Protein concentrations were measured by UV absorbance at 280 nm and adjusted to 2-3 mM for native MS injection.
body_text.section: High-resolution native MS analysis using an Orbitrap EMR

body_text.text: PNGase F was used to remove the N-glycans following the procedure supplied by the manufacturer.
body_text.section: High-resolution native MS analysis using an Orbitrap EMR

body_text.text: 1-3 uL of samples loaded in home-made gold-coated borosilicate capillaries were directly infused into an Exactive Plus Orbitrap instrument with extended mass range (EMR) (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Germany) using an m/z range of 500-10,000 Th.
body_text.section: High-resolution native MS analysis using an Orbitrap EMR

body_text.text: The voltage offsets on transport multi-poles and ion lenses were manually tuned to achieve optimal transmission of protein ions at elevated m/z.
body_text.section: High-resolution native MS analysis using an Orbitrap EMR

body_text.text: Nitrogen was infused in the higher-energy collisional dissociation (HCD) cell at a gas pressure of 6-8 £ 10 ¡10 bar.
body_text.section: High-resolution native MS analysis using an Orbitrap EMR

body_text.text: MS parameters were adjusted as follows: spray voltage 1.2-1.3 V; source fragmentation 30 V; source temperature 250 C; collision energy 30 V; resolution (at m/z 200) 17,500.
body_text.section: High-resolution native MS analysis using an Orbitrap EMR

body_text.text: The instrument was mass-calibrated using CsI clusters, as described previously.
body_text.section: High-resolution native MS analysis using an Orbitrap EMR

body_text.text: 33 The raw mass spectra were deconvoluted using Protein Deconvolution v2.0 (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Germany) andBioAnalyst v1.1 (AB/Sciex, Canada).
body_text.section: High-resolution native MS analysis using an Orbitrap EMR

body_text.text: The deconvoluted data were further processed as described previously to solve the composition of glycosylation and other possible PTMs.
body_text.section: High-resolution native MS analysis using an Orbitrap EMR

body_text.text: 29 Average MW values of individual carbohydrate residues used for MW calculation include: hexose/mannose/galactose (Hex/Man/Gal) -Targeted N-glycan profiling using nanoLC-Chip-Q-TOF MS N-glycans were released from the proteins before the analysis using a nanoLC-chip-Q-TOF MS system.
body_text.section: High-resolution native MS analysis using an Orbitrap EMR

body_text.text: The release, purification, injection, data acquisition and analysis of N-glycan were performed following the described previously protocols.
body_text.section: High-resolution native MS analysis using an Orbitrap EMR

body_text.text: 25 In brief, N-glycans were released from reduced mAb by PNGase F digestion, followed by solid phase extraction (SPE) purification, chemical reduction by NaBH 4 , and SPE again for the removal of reductant.
body_text.section: High-resolution native MS analysis using an Orbitrap EMR

body_text.text: Purified N-glycans were then loaded to Agilent nanoLC-chip-Q-TOF analyzed with the exact same condition of a previously reported human serum N-glycan structural library.
body_text.section: High-resolution native MS analysis using an Orbitrap EMR

body_text.text: A mixture of serum N-glycans standard was prepared and analyzed together with mAb N-glycans to calibrate chromatographic retention times in the serum N-glycan library as described previously.
body_text.section: High-resolution native MS analysis using an Orbitrap EMR

body_text.text: 34 Structures of N-glycan were identified by matching with accurate masses and calibrated chromatographic retention times from the library.
body_text.section: High-resolution native MS analysis using an Orbitrap EMR

body_text.text: Intergrative data construction of pseudo native MS spectrum

We perform in silico data construction to simulate a zerocharge, native MS spectrum based on the masses and relative abundances of glycans identified using targeted glycan profiling, the basic principle of which has been described previously.
body_text.section: Intergrative data construction of pseudo native MS spectrum

body_text.text: 35 The data construction is achieved based on the following 3 elements:
body_text.section: Intergrative data construction of pseudo native MS spectrum

body_text.text: 1) the mass of the mAb backbone;
body_text.section: Intergrative data construction of pseudo native MS spectrum

body_text.text: 2) the masses and relative abundance of the glycans identified by targeted glycan profiling; and
body_text.section: Intergrative data construction of pseudo native MS spectrum

body_text.text: 3) extra modifications on mAb backbone.
body_text.section: Intergrative data construction of pseudo native MS spectrum

body_text.text: To compare the simulated result with the native MS spectra, the native MS spectra (acquired in profile mode) are pre-processed by convoluting the ESI spectrum to a zero-charge state spectrum using the Protein Deconvolution package (Thermo Fisher Scientific).
body_text.section: Intergrative data construction of pseudo native MS spectrum

body_text.text: Subsequently, the standard Pearson
body_text.section: Intergrative data construction of pseudo native MS spectrum

body_text.text: Figure 1 .
N-glycosylation on 3 IgG4-Dhinge mutants are quantitatively profiled at the intact protein and the released glycan level.
body_text.section: Figure 1 .

body_text.text: (A) Deconvoluted native mass spectra of the intact IgG4-Dhinge proteins with all glycoproteoforms baseline-resolved, separated by their MW.
body_text.section: Figure 1 .

body_text.text: Asterisks indicate observed glycine truncations in the mAb backbone.
body_text.section: Figure 1 .

body_text.text: (B) Total ion current (TIC) chromatograms of the released glycans that are separated based on their chromatographic elution time.
body_text.section: Figure 1 .

body_text.text: Signal peaks are color-coded using the same scheme as in (A).
body_text.section: Figure 1 .

body_text.text: (C) Direct comparison of the relative abundances of glycans with different compositions determined by the 2 individual approaches, whereby the consistency between the 2 methods was evaluated using Pearson correlation scores.
body_text.section: Figure 1 .

body_text.text: Quantification data of native MS has been adjusted for glycine truncation.
body_text.section: Figure 1 .

body_text.text: Figure 2 .
Resolving N-glycosylation and other types of modification increasing mAb micro-heterogeneity on therapeutic mAbs.
body_text.section: Figure 2 .

body_text.text: (A) Deconvoluted native MS spectra of N-glycosylated and deglycosylated trastuzumab, revealing only minor modifications besides N-glycosylation.
body_text.section: Figure 2 .

body_text.text: (B) Deconvoluted native MS spectra of infliximab revealing incomplete C-terminal lysine processing of this mAb.
body_text.section: Figure 2 .

body_text.text: The annotations of the glycoforms are color-coded according to the number of clipped Lysine residues.
body_text.section: Figure 2 .

body_text.text: (C) Deconvoluted native MS spectra of bevacizumab suggesting 1-4 hexose residues are still attached after N-deglycosylation revealing the occurrence of extensive glycation (annotated with the green dots).
body_text.section: Figure 2 .

body_text.text: Figure 3 .
Comparison of experimental and simulated spectra.
body_text.section: Figure 3 .

body_text.text: For trastuzumab (A) and bevacizumab (B), the experimental deconvoluted intact protein mass spectra (blue) are compared with the simulated spectra, based on the detected quantitative profile of N-glycosylation and/or other backbone modifications (red).
body_text.section: Figure 3 .

body_text.text: The correlation between data sets is evaluated by means of Pearson Correlation and is 0.92 for trastuzumab and 0.95 for bevacizumab.
body_text.section: Figure 3 .

body_text.text: For bevacizumab, simulation excluding the contribution of glycation (white) results in a significantly lower correlation coefficient (R D 0.69).
body_text.section: Figure 3 .
